name: HandSwitched

series.s: Strictly right-handed people forced to switch
Non strictly right-handed people forced to switch

help:
JSON format help for AgeCat (age vs. category) plots
----------------------------------------------------
Downloadable JSON files for Who Are We Now? are dictionaries.

They always have a "type" field specifying the plot type, and a "name"
field, specifying the plot name. https://whoarewenow.net/plotname
will redirect you to the location of any plot in its chapter.

This one's type is "AgeCat", for plotting weighted binomial distributions
as a function of the respondent's age.

The data are specified in such a way that dynamic rebinning by age is
supported, as well as either weighted or unweighted plotting or analysis.
The weights are calculated using stratified sampling based on demographic
criteria, as explained in the appendix https://whoarewenow.net/appendix.

JSON entries with example values:

Key        Value                 Comment
--------   --------------------  ------------------------------------------
"type"   : "AgeCat"
"name"   : "PlotName"
"x"      : [18,93]               Minimum and maximum+1 age
"bins"   : [18,25,30,40,60,80]   Age bin boundaries
"z"      : 1.64485               Confidence interval Z value (see Appendix)
"seq"    : [Seq1,Seq2,...]       Each sequence is a map per below
"series" : [Series1,Series2,...] Each series is a map per below

Seq specifies the sequence of "stops" in the visualization:

Key        Value                 Comment
--------   --------------------  -------------------------------------------
"i"      : [0,2]                 Indices of series to render for this stop
"y"      : [0,100]               Percent range for this stop

Series specifies the data for all series, as specified by each "i" in "seq":

Key        Value                 Comment
-------    --------------------  -------------------------------------------
"s"      : "All respondents"     Series label
"c"      : "magenta"             Series color
"n"      : [ns]                  For each age, number of nos
"p"      : [ps]                  For each age, number of yeses
"N"      : [Ns]                  For each age, weighted sum of nos
"P"      : [Ps]                  For each age, weighted sum of yeses

Some dictionary key/value pairs are unimportant, used only for debugging or
visualization, and are not documented above.

For more information on the project see https://whoarewenow.net#about
